entry.content:
Chrome Version: (copy from chrome://version) Lacros Version (if applicable): (copy from chrome://version) OS: (e.g. Win10, MacOS 10.12, etc...)
What steps will reproduce the problem? (1) (2) (3)
What is the expected result?
What happens instead?
Please use hotlists and text to provide additional information.
If this is a regression (i.e., worked before), please consider using the bisect tool (https://www.chromium.org/developers/bisect-builds-py) to help us identify the root cause and more rapidly triage the issue.
For graphics-related bugs, please copy/paste the contents of the about://gpu page at the end of this report.

entry.title: Quick Delete animation plays behind the empty tabs screen
entry.content:
When the quick delete animation is triggered from the tab switcher when there are no open tabs, the animation plays behind the empty tabs layout.
Expected behaviour: Animation runs above the empty tabs view similar to how it runs when there are tabs.

entry.title: Print preview from Amazon return page shows 2 blank pages
entry.content:
# Steps to reproduce the problem 1. From Amazon, initiate a return and continue with the flow through the end to the page where the QRcode is displayed 2. Ctrl+P (print) 3. Observe that the preview is completely blank.
# Problem Description 2 Blank pages instead of the actual rendered page(s)
# Additional Comments I have tried chrome://flags/#enable-oop-print-drivers Enabled/Disabled/Default which made no difference. Also tried fully restarting computer, as well as Chrome. Checked for updates. Tested and reproduced on macOS 14 and Windows 11.
See attached screenshot.
# Summary Print preview from Amazon return page shows 2 blank pages
# Additional Data Category: UI \ Chrome Channel: Stable \ Regression: Yes

entry.title: attribution_interop_fuzzer: Out-of-memory in attribution_interop_fuzzer
entry.content:
Detailed Report: https://clusterfuzz.com/testcase?key=6015969903181824
Fuzzing Engine: libFuzzer Fuzz Target: attribution_interop_fuzzer Job Type: libfuzzer_chrome_asan_debug Platform Id: linux
Crash Type: Out-of-memory (exceeds 2560 MB) Crash Address: Crash State: attribution_interop_fuzzer
Sanitizer: address (ASAN)
Regressed: https://clusterfuzz.com/revisions?job=libfuzzer_chrome_asan_debug&range=1283566:1283575
Reproducer Testcase: https://clusterfuzz.com/download?testcase_id=6015969903181824
Issue filed automatically.
See https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/master/testing/libfuzzer/reproducing.md for instructions on reproducing this bug locally.

entry.title: dawn_wire_server_and_frontend_fuzzer: Null-dereference READ in dawn::native::DeviceBase::APICreateShaderModule
entry.content:
Detailed Report: https://clusterfuzz.com/testcase?key=5412934164348928
Fuzzing Engine: libFuzzer Fuzz Target: dawn_wire_server_and_frontend_fuzzer Job Type: libfuzzer_chrome_ubsan Platform Id: linux
Crash Type: Null-dereference READ Crash Address: 0x000000000000 Crash State: dawn::native::DeviceBase::APICreateShaderModule dawn::wire::server::Server::DoDeviceCreateShaderModule dawn::wire::server::Server::HandleDeviceCreateShaderModule
Sanitizer: undefined (UBSAN)
Regressed: https://clusterfuzz.com/revisions?job=libfuzzer_chrome_ubsan&range=1284978:1284986
Reproducer Testcase: https://clusterfuzz.com/download?testcase_id=5412934164348928
Issue filed automatically.
See https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/master/testing/libfuzzer/reproducing.md for instructions on reproducing this bug locally.

entry.title: Introduce WebGPUContextProvider that can then be implemented by TestContextProvider
entry.content:
@bialpio was so far unable to figure out how to fake/mock GPU dependencies for VideoEffectsProcessorImpl so that the unittests are happy. Failed attempt at: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5428981/1/
Chatted with kylechar@ a bit. Ideally, we should not rely on `viz::ContextProviderCommandBuffer` directly - instead, we should use the `RasterContextProvider` and the (currently unavailable) `WebGPUContextProvider` & inject test implementation (e.g. `TestContextProvider`) to code under test in unittests. We'd have to make the `TestContextProvider` implement this new `WebGPUContextProvider`, but we'd also need a `TestWebGPUInterface` implementation.

entry.title: Tests are failing: hit_test_region_observer.cc(68): Failed\nRunLoop::Run() timed out. Timeout set at ProxyRunTestOnMainThreadLoop@content/public/test/browser_test_bas...
entry.content:
This bug is for all test failures where the primary error message is similiar to the following (ignoring numbers and hexadecimal values): hit_test_region_observer.cc(68): Failed\nRunLoop::Run() timed out. Timeout set at ProxyRunTestOnMainThreadLoop@content/public/test/browser_test_base.cc:851.
The following test(s) were observed to have matching failures at this time (at most five examples listed): - ninja://chrome/test:browser_tests/PDFExtensionIsolatedContentTest.HistoryNavigation/All.OOPIF_SITE_ISOLATED - ninja://chrome/test:browser_tests/PDFExtensionLoadTest.Load/PDFTestFiles.OOPIF_2 - ninja://chrome/test:browser_tests/PDFExtensionContentSettingJSTest.NoBeepThenBeep/All.1 - ninja://chrome/test:browser_tests/PdfFindRequestManagerTestWithPdfPartialLoading.FindInChunkedPDF - ninja://chrome/test:browser_tests/PDFExtensionAccessibilityTreeDumpTest.Images/All.OOPIF_blink
These test failures are causing problem(s) which require your attention, including: - many gardened builders are failing
See current problems, failure examples and more in LUCI Analysis at: https://luci-analysis.appspot.com/p/chromium/rules/050a0deb67b19f2abeb4e41bd7346aa7
How to action this bug: https://luci-analysis.appspot.com/help#new-bug-filed Provide feedback: https://luci-analysis.appspot.com/help#feedback Was this bug filed in the wrong component? See: https://luci-analysis.appspot.com/help#component-selection

entry.title: inspector-protocol/emulation/set-vision-deficiency.js test is flaky
entry.content:
inspector-protocol/emulation/set-vision-deficiency.js
Text Failure on WebKit Win10, WebKit Linux Leak and linux-bfcache-rel. builder
Test History Link: WebKit Win10: https://ci.chromium.org/ui/test/chromium%3Aci/ninja%3A%2F%2F%3Ablink_web_tests%2Finspector-protocol%2Femulation%2Fset-vision-deficiency.js?q=VHASH%3A329768773e20e824
WebKit Linux Leak: https://ci.chromium.org/ui/test/chromium%3Aci/ninja%3A%2F%2F%3Ablink_web_tests%2Finspector-protocol%2Femulation%2Fset-vision-deficiency.js?q=VHASH%3Aa7adfaf7d8e0d677
linux-bfcache-rel: https://ci.chromium.org/ui/test/chromium%3Aci/ninja%3A%2F%2F%3Ablink_web_tests%2Finspector-protocol%2Femulation%2Fset-vision-deficiency.js?q=VHASH%3A8fa09b1be906ddd0
Win10 Tests x64:https://ci.chromium.org/ui/test/chromium%3Aci/ninja%3A%2F%2F%3Ablink_web_tests%2Finspector-protocol%2Femulation%2Fset-vision-deficiency.js?q=VHASH%3A7e353daf16cd015d
Win11 Tests x64: https://ci.chromium.org/ui/test/chromium%3Aci/ninja%3A%2F%2F%3Ablink_web_tests%2Finspector-protocol%2Femulation%2Fset-vision-deficiency.js?q=VHASH%3A96863daaa73a7f7f
Dashboard: https://data.corp.google.com/sites/chrome_generic_flakiness_dashboard_datasite/top_flakes/?f=test_id:eq:ninja:%2F%2F:blink_web_tests%2Finspector-protocol%2Femulation%2Fset-vision-deficiency.js&f=realm:in:(null)&f=variant_test_suite:in:blink_web_tests&can=2
and average 30.49% flaky rate in runs mostly on Win and Linux builders

entry.title: vt: Flaky tests on Mac
entry.content:
These four tests were split off from issue 333591610:
``` virtual/view-transition-mpa-serialization/external/wpt/css/css-view-transitions/clip-path-larger-than-border-box-on-child-of-named-element.html virtual/view-transition-wide-gamut/external/wpt/css/css-view-transitions/clip-path-larger-than-border-box-on-child-of-named-element.html virtual/view-transition-wide-gamut/external/wpt/css/css-view-transitions/pseudo-with-classes-match-multiple-wildcard.html virtual/view-transition/external/wpt/css/css-view-transitions/clip-path-larger-than-border-box-on-child-of-named-element.html ```
as they actually do fail on the skia-graphite bot but also fail on other Mac bots at least flakily so I moved them into TestExpectations.
I suspect this isn't actually a graphite issue but a more general Mac flakiness issue we need to investigate.

entry.title: GetNullAggregatableReports needs more unit-test coverage
entry.content: Right now we only test the number of reports generated, but not their fake source times.

entry.title: Emit the relevant bug ID when a test is "failed as expected" or "skipped" or..

When a test is "failed as expected" or "was skipped", it would be nice to see the relevant line from the expectations file that was applied.
The bug ID in particular would be very helpful, such as:
"test XXX failed as expected; see crbug.com/YYY"
or the file and line number:
"test XXX failed as expected (foo/expectations.txt:1234)"

entry.title: Remove support for the gold linker
entry.content:
I tried switching off the `use_lld` GN variable and switching on `use_gold`, and libbase.so does not link:
``` local_rustc_sysroot/lib/rustlib/x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu/lib/libcore_core.rlib(libcore_core.core.8dff24bba1aa2792-cgu.06.rcgu.o):core.8dff24bba1aa2792-cgu.06:function core::panicking::panic_fmt:(.text.unlikely._ZN4core9panicking9panic_fmt17h3f187acd826c2967E+0x31): error: undefined reference to 'rust_begin_unwind' ```
Next, I tried turning off Rust, and quickly found out that's not going to happen. It may be time to get rid of `use_gold`.
https://github.com/rui314/mold does show a Chromium linking benchmark with gold, so there may be some way of making it work, but it also shows gold is several times slower than lld and mold. Realistically, Chromium developers are not going to use gold, so all the gold-specific build rules are effectively unused.

entry.title: Low contrast text when Web Store theme is installed in dark mode
entry.content:
When installing a web store theme and your Chrome is in dark mode, the "Drag an image here or" text is low contrast and doesn't respond to dark mode like the rest of the UI.
The same background image when selected through the Customize Chrome side panel does theme properly.

entry.title: Create an internal repository for internal icons in downloads
entry.content: The ESB Download Row promo uses the google shield branded icon and right now the downloads part of web-ui doesn't contain a way to differentiate branded and non-branded icons.

entry.title: [run_web_tests.py] Report all failure reasons to ResultDB
entry.content:
When a web test fails in CQ/CI, `run_web_tests.py` can report a free-form "failure reason" to ResultDB for failure identification/clustering by LUCI analysis (e.g., the [first testharness `FAIL` or `Harness Error` line](https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:third_party/blink/tools/blinkpy/web_tests/models/test_failures.py;l=447-454;drc=7ab057f2a70f2899ced156079fe3d2c820dde195;bpv=0;bpt=0)). According to [the protobuf](https://source.chromium.org/chromium/_/chromium/infra/luci/luci-go/+/ebb2b8fefdd6fe39a4062c337469124f26d51614:resultdb/proto/v1/failure_reason.proto;l=53-67;drc=6c2c6d60cc6c7890e6f3546797fb9bda9cb5f693;bpv=0;bpt=0), there can be multiple failure reasons now, so we can report all testharness `FAIL` lines and not just the first one.
`run_wpt_tests.py` also doesn't report failure reason at all, but should share the `run_web_tests.py` code to do so.

entry.title: [run_web_tests.py] Explicitly specified directories are still skipped
entry.content:
Even if a test is marked as skipped in TestExpectations, `run_web_tests.py` still runs it [if it's explicitly specified on the command line](https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:third_party/blink/tools/blinkpy/web_tests/controllers/web_test_finder.py;l=281-282;drc=a949ab1a98a084f8e4e607091e375c53cff3ab1a;bpv=0;bpt=0) by default. However, it doesn't have this behavior when the argument is a directory of tests, which seems surprising:
``` → echo 'external/wpt/badging/* [ Skip ]' >> NeverFixTests → ../tools/run_web_tests.py -t Default external/wpt/badging ... No tests to run. → ../tools/run_web_tests.py -t Default external/wpt/badging/badge-success.https.html ...
[1/1] external/wpt/badging/badge-success.https.html passed unexpectedly 1.1260s Finally stop servers and clean up
0 tests ran as expected, 1 didn't: external/wpt/badging/badge-success.https.html ```
This also affects `run_wpt_tests.py`, where tests are [skipped by default](https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:third_party/blink/web_tests/NeverFixTests;l=2075;drc=70499b63a39f06900efb73dba9963c2c354e1035;bpv=0;bpt=0).

entry.title: Update calls used for creating CookiePartitionKeys in webview to provide correct ancestor chain bit
entry.content:
The inclusion of the ancestor chain bit into partitioned cookies requires some work to update how webview uses the net::CookiePartitionKey factory methods to provide the correct values needed to set the net::CookiePartitionKey::AncestorChainBit. Partitioned cookies are going to be disabled in m125 but this should be addressed before they are enabled again.
CL containing sites in question: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5405466
CL for disabling CHIPS: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5398598

entry.title: WCAG 2.2 - 2.5.8 Target Size - Minimum
entry.content:
WCAG 2.2 - 2.5.8 requires that interactable elements must have a minimum size of 24px [1]. There are a number of UI elements in DevTools that do not conform to this requirement. I've attached a few examples to this bug.
I'm looking to fix these bugs chromium. I'm curious if this is an a11y requirement you all are willing to adhere to support and take fixes for.
[1] https://www.w3.org/WAI/WCAG22/Understanding/target-size-minimum

entry.title: Images are not sized correctly inside flexbox container.
entry.content:
# Steps to reproduce the problem This is difficult to reproduce in isolation. Consider the following page: https://www.deviantart.com/roen911/art/Hauler-Brengun-Dewoitine-D-520-1038627154 1. Problem is resolution dependent. My resolution is 2560x1440 but 1080p would be enough to highlight the issue too. 2. From the primary image, remove the srcset attribute and the width and height properties. Doing this should allow the image to stretch to its native size, within the bounds of the container. It does not on chrome - but it does on firefox.
What makes me consider this a bug is, I found an instance where this behaviour directly contradicts the CSS spec. While searching for workarounds, I found a solution using `object-fit`. 1. Add `align-items: normal;` to the parent flexbox. 2. Add `object-fit: scale-down;` to the image. This will make it behave as expected, however the object-fit spec: https://drafts.csswg.org/css-images/#the-object-fit says: scale-down _Size the content as if none or contain were specified, whichever would result in a smaller concrete object size._
On chrome this is not true - `none` produces a smaller image than `contain`, but `scale-down` chooses the bigger size, in direct contradiction with the spec (though only because the `none` size is seemingly incorrect). On firefox no change in dimensions is observed.
# Problem Description In certain situations, images fail to expand to fit inside a larger flexbox container.
# Additional Comments Attached are 2 screenshots that hopefully demonstrate the inconsistency.
# Summary Images are not sized correctly inside flexbox container.
# Custom Questions #### Which component does this fall under? Blink>CSS
#### Does this work in other browsers? Yes - This is just a Chrome problem
# Additional Data Category: API \ Chrome Channel: Stable \ Regression: N/A

entry.title: Wrong animation when switch mode in TabGrid
entry.content:
Precondition: have some incognito and non-incognito tabs
1. Open the TabGrid from a regular tab 2. Swipe to incognito 3. Open an incognito tab
Expected: the opened tab should expand from its place in the grid
Actual: the opened tab does a fade in
